titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of his papers at Syracuse University
titlestmt.author: [Summit record]

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Papers of the American author, New York Times art critic. Correspondence, biographical materials, manuscript reviews and articles.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p:
John Canaday (1907-) was an American writer and art critic for the
New York Times.

Born in Fort Scott, Kansas, on Feb. 1, 1907, Canaday received his B.A. from the University of Texas in 1929 and his M.A. from Yale in 1933. From 1938 to 1950, Mr. Canaday taught art history in the department of architecture at the University of Virginia. From 1950-1952, he served as director of the Newcomb School of Art at Tulane University. In 1953, he became Chief of the Division of Education of the Philadelphia Museum of Art, a position which he held until 1959. Beginning in 1959, Canaday served as art critic for the
New York Times. He wrote a series, "Metropolitan Seminars in Art," as well as
Mainstreams of Modern Art,
Embattled Critic, and articles for various magazines. He also published seven mystery novels under the pseudonym "Matthew Head."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p:
The
John Canaday Papers consist of biographical material, correspondence, and manuscripts.
Correspondence, which includes both incoming and outgoing, is almost entirely related to Canaday's articles; the small amount which does not is at the end of the series.
Manuscripts are of articles, all untitled, and book reviews.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Correspondence, both incoming and outgoing, is arranged chronologically according to the date of publication of the article to which it relates. Correspondence unrelated to any specific article is arranged alphabetically by subject. Manuscripts are subdivided by type (articles and reviews).

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

did.unittitle: "Survey with a Hopeful Ear to the Ground"
(Magazine section) "Monet's Eye and the Camel's Eye"
"Sir Herbert Read: In Defense of Abstract Art"
"Is Less More, and When for Whom
"Art Critic Finds Hint of Sanity in Auto Design"
(Magazine section) "Who's Who and Why of Collectors"
(Magazine Section) "Lessons of the Very Young Masters"
"Art and the Artist, and the Bookmaker, Too"
"Armory Show, or, Whatever Became of Avant-Garde?"
"Two Ways to Do It: DeKooning and Anderson"
"Handy Little Hot Weather Manual for Prospective Art Critics"
"A Wee Plug for a Worthy Cause"
"This Way (and That) to the American Art Shows"
